attributes.action: General elections after the UK referendum and after presentation of BREXIT plan
attributes.additional_details: The economic, political and social future of the UK is uncertain for years. The referendum was not a vote for a Brexiteer government.  Brexiteers need to come up with a short, medium and long term plan and well thought through vision, present this to parliament and the population. The same applies for other parties. Immediately afterwards, the populations needs to have the right to choose which party they trust most with this challenging tasks ahead through their vote in general elections .
attributes.background: The referendum resultet in a small minority of just over 50% of voters to leave the EU. The political leadership is broken down, negativ economical effects have emerged already. The UK situation is historically unique and has long term effects for future generations. General elections are necessary.
